column4: I imagine everyone looking for w32codecs is just getting this pkg error right now
its a simple case of the file having a different name
where do these packages live and can I interrupt an install long enough to correct the path?
or am I going the wrong way about this?
you could pipe the list to a file
and add the rm if they don't have some commonality
search for bandwidth in synaptic. there are some monitors
so you are on dapper, if you upgraded
I see. you don't suppose it's fixable?
yes on 1st June I 'upgraded' to it
just get the .deb and sudo dpkg -i it
